Key Match Events: Orlando made 19 3-pointers to control the game most of the way.
Suggs twisted awkwardly as he fell with 3:06 to play in the second quarter and left the court in a wheelchair.
Orlando opened a 19-point lead when Caldwell-Pope made a layup off a feed from Anthony with 7:40 remaining in the third quarter.
Barnes scored the first five points of the fourth quarter to cut the lead to 15.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Mose on Tristan da Silva: 'He's definitely not getting enough recognition as a rookie.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Orlando shot 9-for-14 from 3-point range in the first quarter to take a 37-24 lead.
Toronto opened the second quarter with a 7-3 burst.
Suggs added a 3-pointer to complete a 10-0 run that bumped the margin to 19 points with 6:53 remaining in the first half.
Orlando led 88-68 after the third quarter.
Barnes' 3-pointer with 9:18 to play trimmed Orlando’s lead to 90-78, and Ja’Kobe Walter’s trey further sliced the gap to nine with 6:04 to go.
Anthony scored seven straight points and Orlando led by 17 with 2:03 to play.
Others: RJ Barrett (illness) and Orlando’s Anthony Black (back) did not play.
